Card.Name: Blurry Affliction
Card.Hint: Monsters aim at you as if you had Invisibility.
Card.Description: All players permanently have Doom's Partial Invisibility Power Up effect active, without the fuzzy transparency. For the uninitiated, this means monsters will have difficulty aiming at you and cause them to attack slightly to the left and right of their target.

Card.Name: The Bleeding
Card.Hint: Players heal nearby monsters when damaged.
Card.Description: Whenever a player takes damage, nearby monsters are healed. Monsters receive double the amount of damage dealt to a player. Monsters cannot over heal and will not be healed beyond their original health pool.

Card.Name: Paranoia
Card.Hint: You hear monsters in your head.
Card.Description: During the level players will periodically hear monster sounds at different volumes, potentially confusing them with false audio cues. If picked as a permanent card, it will learn what sounds monsters can make in each level and use them over the course of an entire run.

Card.Name: Abandon Timeline
Card.Hint: Destroy your cards and get a new random set.
Card.Description: Destroy your current collection of cards and get new ones. Any cards chosen before this one are replaced with new cards chosen at random, completely changing the rules of the game. The new cards can only be picked if they can be generated in the current level. For example, if your map's monsters only contain Imps, you will not get cards that effect Cacodemons. This card can only appear on every permanent 7th card choice. Random cards generated by this card will not be added to the compendium.

Card.Name: Hex Mania
Card.Hint: Your Curse cards effect an additional monster.
Card.Description: Every curse card in your collection will be applied to an extra monster. If you have a single curse card, an additional different monster will be given the same curse. If you own two curse cards, two extra monsters would be selected to get each curse, and so on. This card follows the same selection rules as regular curse cards, which makes it possible for a single monster to end up with two different curses.

Card.Name: Witching Hour
Card.Hint: When a cursed monster dies, the curse is applied to another.
Card.Description: When a cursed monster dies, the curse will be applied to another random monster in the level. Curses are not distributed immediately, and instead are given out one minute after a cursed monster dies. A bell sound can be heard in the distance when this happens. As with curse cards, the same rules apply

Card.Name: Parasitic Card
Card.Hint: One of your other cards will mutate into a new random card.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, one of your other permanent cards is transformed into a new one. The new card is chosen at random from the pool of possible cards that could appear in that level. The old card is permanently replaced with the new one. Certain cards, such as ones that alter your collection, cannot be transformed. Cards cannot mutate into card types that are already in effect, and mutated cards are not added to the compendium. This card can only be offered as a permanent card.

Card.Name: Unlucky Number
Card.Hint: Player damage halved while the kill count is a multiple of ?.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, each player gets a random number selected and displayed for them. While the kill counter is multiple of the player's number, their damage will be cut in half. The unlucky number will be broadcast at the start of the level, and the number will be displayed on the hud while the kill counter is a multiple of the unlucky number.

Card.Name: Patience
Card.Hint: Killing a monster disables items for 3 seconds.
Card.Description: Upon killing a monster, that player will be unable to pick up any items off the floor. After 3 seconds this effect ends. While items are disabled, a sigil is displayed above the item.

Card.Name: Barrels of Fun
Card.Hint: Add lots of explosive barrels to the level.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, spawn lots of explosive barrels in the level. The barrels are scattered randomly in the level, avoiding troublesome spots such as teleport destinations. The number of barrels spawned is dependent on the amount of monsters in the map, but is limited to 200 (for every copy of this card).

Card.Name: Mystery Eggs
Card.Hint: Add lots of eggs that contain ???
Card.Description: At the start of the level, spawn lots of mysterious eggs in the level. The eggs may contain an item, a monster, an explosive surprise or nothing at all. The egg must be destroyed in order to free its contents. If a monster is inside the egg, it may hatch on its own if a player gets too close to it. It may also spawn as a baby monster, which are smaller and weaker. The number of eggs spawned is dependent on the amount of monsters in the map, but is limited to 50 (for every copy of this card).

Card.Name: Fireball Traps
Card.Hint: Add several Fireball traps to the level.
Card.Description: Adds Fireball wall traps to random areas in the level. Fireball traps spawn on walls and repeatedly shoot projectiles in one direction. If they are obstructed by terrain or the surface they are attached to is moved, the trap will be disarmed. Fireballs deal 10 damage to players and monsters. If monsters are not distracted, they will focus on avoiding the projectile and not take damage from them. The number of Fireball traps that spawn is dependent on the amount of monsters in the map, but is limited to 40 (for every copy of this card).

Card.Name: Volcanic Traps
Card.Hint: Add exploding floor traps to the level.
Card.Description: Adds Volcanic floor traps to random areas in the level. Volcanic traps spawn from floors and repeatedly let out an explosive burst in a timed sequence. The bursts deal up to 20 explosive damage to players in a short radius. Monsters can only take a maximum of 5 damage from these traps. The number of Volcanic traps that spawn is dependent on the amount of monsters in the map, but is limited to 40 (for every copy of this card).

Card.Name: Teleport Traps
Card.Hint: Add traps to the level that teleport monsters and projectiles.
Card.Description: Add Teleport traps to random areas in the level. Teleport traps spawn in pairs at different locations and are linked to each other. Any monster or projectile that enters the trap will be teleported to the location of the other trap. Monsters will not teleport if something is obstructing the destination of the teleport trap. Players cannot use the traps to teleport themselves, but can fire projectiles into them. The number of Teleport traps that spawn is dependent on the amount of monsters in the map, but is limited to 20 (for every copy of this card).

Card.Name: Healing Traps
Card.Hint: Add several healing traps to the level.
Card.Description: Adds Healing traps to random areas in the level. Healing traps appear on the floor and heal nearby injured monsters in a large radius. Monsters within the radius are healed every three seconds. The first heal they receive will heal for for 150 health points, and every subsequent heal will heal 30 health points. Monsters cannot be healed by multiple Healing Traps at once. The number of Healing traps that spawn is dependent on the amount of monsters in the map, but is limited to 20 (for every copy of this card).

Card.Name: Dart Traps
Card.Hint: Add several Dart traps to the level.
Card.Description: Adds Poisonous Dart traps to the level. Dart Traps appear near items and are invisible to the player. Upon walking over them, a sound will play before a volley of darts will be fired from one of the nearby walls. Players and monsters both take small damage from each individual dart, but the amount of darts can make traps lethal. Players are also temporarily slowed by the poison in each dart. Additional copies of this card add even more dart traps to the level.

Card.Name: Accelerated Boost
Card.Hint: All projectiles travel faster.
Card.Description: All projectiles, from monsters or players, have a slight speed increase.

Card.Name: Surprise Boss
Card.Hint: Add a # somewhere in the level.
Card.Description: At the start of the level a Cyberdemon is spawned somewhere in the level, but not too close to players. If the Cyberdemon has been replaced by mod, it spawns whatever monster would replace it.

Card.Name: Vile Guardians
Card.Hint: Keys are guarded by Archviles.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, an Archvile will spawn at each key location.

Card.Name: Summon Illusions
Card.Hint: Add "harmless" illusions to the level.
Card.Description: At the start of the game, illusions of monsters currently in the level will spawn at random locations. Depending on the amount of monsters in the level, up to 30 illusions can spawn. Illusions appear and act identical to regular monsters (and are even effected by other cards), but deal no damage to players. They are removed upon taking any player damage, do not trigger any death effects or leave a corpse. Though they cannot deal direct damage to players, they can still cause trouble in other ways... especially if they summon or resurrect enemies!

Card.Name: The Specialists
Card.Hint: You will be attacked by #!
Card.Description: At some point in the level, you will be attacked by an elite team of monsters. The team will consist of four monster types that already exist in the level, and will each receive a unique set of enchantments and buffs. They will spawn near a player and immediately start hunting them, demanding their attention. The team also gets a randomly generated name to strike fear into players. If picked as a permanent card, the same team will attack you every level.

Card.Name: Earthquake!
Card.Hint: An earthquake may occur.
Card.Description: At a random point in time, an earthquake will occur to shake things up. During the earthquake monsters, items and players are thrown around randomly. Monsters take small amounts of damage during the earthquake. Flying monsters, corpses and keys are not effected by the earthquake.

Card.Name: Haunted House
Card.Hint: You may be haunted by vengeful spirits.
Card.Description: At a random point in time, 20 ghosts will spawn surrounding the player in a very large radius. Ghost monsters retain all the abilities of the monster that died and immediately start chasing the player. Ghosts move slower and have half the health of the original monster, but can walk through walls and objects to reach their target. Ghosts will eventually fade out of existence. Running away from them can be a viable strategy to conserve ammo.

Card.Name: Revise Strategy
Card.Hint: Monster starting positions are shuffled.
Card.Description: Monster locations are shuffled at the start of the level. The card will attempt to swap every single monster's position in the level with another. If a monster is too large to fit in another monster's spot, their positions will not be swapped.

Card.Name: Nukage Rain
Card.Hint: Damaging acid rain will fall outside.
Card.Description: Every few minutes, acid rain will fall from the sky, damaging any players under it. The damage is similar to damage caused by many damaging floors, and can even be negated by Radiation Suits and similar items. Rain can only fall in areas where the sky is exposed. If other rain cards are also in effect, the different rain types will fall in sequence instead of at the same time.

Card.Name: Blood Rain
Card.Hint: Blood rain will fall outside, empowering monsters.
Card.Description: Every few minutes, blood rain will fall from the sky, buffing any monsters under it. Monsters under the effects of blood rain gain double damage and increased movement speed. Rain can only fall in areas where the sky is exposed. If other rain cards are also in effect, the different rain types will fall in sequence instead of at the same time.

Card.Name: Rescue Mission
Card.Hint: Find Daisy before exiting the level, or else...
Card.Description: Daisy, the marine's pet bunny, will appear somewhere. She must be found and picked up before exiting the level. Daisy will spawn in the level near an item, usually inside of a secret area. She will wander around randomly until a player picks her up. If you listen carefully, it's possible to hear her if you're nearby. If players leave the level before she is found, she will be killed. The monsters will feed off of the grief you feel for leaving her behind, and will gain a random card enchantment at the start of the next level. If multiple copies of this card are active, players will have extra daisy babies to find before leaving the level.

Card.Name: Overgrowth
Card.Hint: Add vegetation near certain monsters.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, vegetation is added around certain monsters in the level These plants cannot be interacted with and simply block the player's sight, making it more difficult to see monsters and projectiles. A maximum of 30 bushes can be spawned with this card, however stacking the card can increase the amount.

Card.Name: The Nest
Card.Hint: Add spawn pods to the level that spawn random monsters.
Card.Description: Adds several monster spawning pods to the level. These spawn pods spawn random monsters of monster types that exist in the current level. Spawn pods will continuously spawn monsters, and must be killed to stop them. Each spawn pod is limited to 5 spawned monsters on the map, and will only spawn new ones if any of those 5 have died. Spawn pods can be resurrected by certain effects.

Card.Name: Quantum Malfunction
Card.Hint: Monster Gangs teleport to random locations instead.
Card.Description: Shortly after a monster spawns from a Monster Gang card, they will be teleported to a random position in the level. This card will affect all active cards that spawn gangs of monsters.

Card.Name: Enchanted Portals
Card.Hint: Monster Gangs spawn with a random enchantment.
Card.Description: When a monster gang arrives, the portal they arrive in grants the monsters a random enchantment. The enchantment given to monsters is different for each portal that opens up. This card will affect all active cards that spawn gangs of monsters.

Card.Name: Monster Squad
Card.Hint: A gang of various monsters may spawn.
Card.Description: At some point during the level, a number of monsters will begin spawning at one location. The location is random, but it will never be too close to any players. The type of monsters is random each time. You will be alerted when the gang starts to arrive.

Card.Name: Miniboss Attack
Card.Hint: A gang of miniature bosses will spawn.
Card.Description: At some point during the level, a number of bosses will begin spawning at one location. The location is random, but it will never be too close to any players. The bosses are miniaturized. They have less health and deal less damage. You will be alerted when the gang starts to arrive.

Card.Name: Painted Statues
Card.Hint: Monster Statues keep their coloration.
Card.Description: Monster Statues that are created by other cards will keep the coloration of the original monster, making them even more difficult to distinguish from regular monsters.

Card.Name: Garden of Statues
Card.Hint: Add monster statues to the level. Some may be alive...
Card.Description: At the start of the level, spawn lots of monster statues in the level. Monster statues are solid objects that can be pushed around and block entities and projectiles. They are sturdy, but can be destroyed with enough damage or if they drop from a tall height. Some monster statues may come alive and attack players. These stone monsters are slower, make no sound and leave no corpse. Enchantment cards affecting monsters may also be applied to monster statues.

Card.Name: Rigged Supplies
Card.Hint: Add several fake items to the level that eject grenades.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, several fake items are placed in random areas. These fake items cannot be collected, and will begin ejecting Hell Grenades when approached by players. The grenades will bounce off of surfaces before exploding, and can damage both players and monsters.

Card.Name: Trick Switches
Card.Hint: Switches may have additional functions.
Card.Description: Switches in the level may gain additional functionality. The functions are usually negative effects but can occasionally aid the player in some situations. If this card is stacked, switches can have even more functions added to them.

Card.Name: Marine Allies
Card.Hint: Add friendly marines to the level. If they die, they become possessed.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, friendly marines will be added to the level. Marines will actively hunt other monsters with their shotguns, aiding the player in battle. Marines may accidentally damage and be damaged by players. Once a marine dies it will become possessed, and be resurrected. Resurrected marines will instead try to kill players and ignore monsters.

Card.Name: Piloted Mechs
Card.Hint: Add mechs to the level that contain a monster.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, several piloted mechs will be added to the level. These mechs are able to fire plasma bolts at a disatnce, or chainsaw players up close. Mechs are piloted by a random monster, which will burst out upon destroying the mech.

Card.Name: Warring Factions
Card.Hint: Two gangs of monsters appear. They fight!
Card.Description: At some point during the level, two portals will open nearby and begin spawning monsters. The monster types are picked at random for each portal, and they will begin targetting monsters spawned from the other portal. Monsters will only begin attacking players normally once all monsters from the portal have been slain, or if they are damaged by a player.

Card.Name: Mystical Urns
Card.Hint: Add urns to the level that give a random enchantment to monsters when destroyed.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, spawn lots of breakable urns to the level. The urns are scattered randomly in the level, avoiding troublesome spots such as teleport destinations. When broken by a player or monster, any nearby monsters recieve a random enchantment. The number of urns spawned is dependent on the amount of monsters in the map, but is limited to 50 (for every copy of this card).

Card.Name: Spring-loaded Loot
Card.Hint: Items may jump away from approaching players.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, random items are fitted with springs. If a player approaches one of these items, will jump away from the player. This effect can only trigger once per item. Carried items will not jump until their carrier is slain.

Card.Name: Boss-in-a-Box
Card.Hint: Add a random item to the level. A boss hides inside.
Card.Description: At the start of the level a random item is spawned somewhere. When a player approaches this item, they will be knocked back and a random boss monster will be spawned.

Card.Name: Haunted Ground
Card.Hint: Several areas become inhabited by vengeful spirits.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, several areas become haunted grounds. If a player is standing in these grounds, a random ghost monster will spawn near the player. Haunted ground can be identified by a skeleton sitting on the ground, which always sits in the center of the haunted ground. Ghost monsters retain all the abilities of the monster that died and immediately start chasing the player. Ghosts move slower and have half the health of the original monster, but can walk through walls and objects to reach their target.

Card.Name: Enchanting Teleports
Card.Hint: When a monster teleports, it may be given a random enchantment.
Card.Description: Whenever a teleporter is used by a monster or a card effect causes an monster to teleport, it will be given a random enchantment. The enchantment chosen can be any random enchantment, even if no enchantment cards are currently in play. This card can only give out 5 enchantments per second, which means if 10 monsters teleport at once, only 5 will recieve enchantments.

Card.Name: Lock-on Teleports
Card.Hint: When a monster teleports, it may instead teleport near a player.
Card.Description: Whenever a monster would use a teleport or teleport using another card effect, it may teleport near a player instead. This effect can only trigger once every five seconds.

Card.Name: Guild of Assassins
Card.Hint: 5 random monsters will try to assassinate you.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, 5 random monsters are added to the level as Assassins. They will appear near unsuspecting players at some point during the level. Assassins will try not to make any noise and will immediately start to close in on the player's position. They will never infight and are much more aggressive, attacking immediately and continuously. They also have slightly increased health and deal much more damage. This card cannot make boss monsters assassins.

Card.Name: Omen of Death
Card.Hint: A cloaked figure will appear. Then something terrible will happen...
Card.Description: At some point during the level, a cloaked figure will appear near a player. This mysterious figure is a bad omen, and a random dangerous event will shortly follow.

Card.Name: Defective Turrets
Card.Hint: Add turrets to the level that change team when damaged.
Card.Description: At the start of the level several turrets will be added to random ceilings. These turrets will start firing bullets shortly after seeing an enemy. The light below the turret indicates what the turret decides are enemies. If it is red, it will target players. If it is green, it will target monsters. If the turret is hit, its color will change. Monsters hit by the turret may retaliate and hit the turret, changing it back to red. Turrets cannot be destroyed by normal means.

Card.Name: Gas Pods
Card.Hint: Add gas pods to the level that spit toxic gas.
Card.Description: Adds several Gas Pods to the level Gas pods will begin throwing out bouncing poison bombs upon seeing a player. The bombs explode into gas which damages players. The Gas Pods will continously do this until killed. The poison does not affect monsters. Gas pods can be resurrected by certain effects.

Card.Name: 16th Sin
Card.Hint: A monster will spawn every 16th kill.
Card.Description: After 16 monsters have been slain by a player, a random monster will spawn near them. The monster chosen can be of any type of monster encountered previously.

Card.Name: Hell's Answer
Card.Hint: A boss monster will spawn every 42nd kill.
Card.Description: After 42 monsters have been slain by a player, a random boss monster will spawn near them. The boss monster selected will be any previously encountered boss monster.

Card.Name: The Chosen One
Card.Hint: One monster is invulnerable until most monsters are slain.
Card.Description: One monster is selected at the start of the level to be the Chosen One. This monster is invulnerable and cannot be damaged by normal means. The only way to disable the invulnerability is to slay 90% of the level's total monster count. Achieving this will make make the monster killable, and you will be notified when this happens.

Card.Name: Spirit Link
Card.Hint: Two monsters are linked. If one dies, the other may re-summon it somewhere.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, two monsters are selected and linked spiritually. They can be identified by their swirling yin-yang sigil. If one of the monster dies and is not resurrected within 30 seconds, the other monster will summon a new copy of its linked partner somewhere in the level. To stop the monsters from bringing each other back indefinitely, they must both be slain within the 30 second time window.

Card.Name: Explosive Death
Card.Hint: Monsters explode violently on death.
Card.Description: Monsters will explode after dying, dealing moderate damage to anything near them. Monsters still leave behind a corpse, and the damage dealt is less than that of a rocket. If this card is offered more than once, it can be chosen again to increase the damage and size of the explosion.

Card.Name: Iron Skins
Card.Hint: All monsters have a lower flinch chance.
Card.Description: Monsters have a lower flinch chance. This greatly reduces the chance a monster will flinch in pain upon taking damage, possibly making the monster unable to flinch at all. This card can stack, continuously halving the monster's chance to flinch.

Card.Name: The Masquerade
Card.Hint: Monsters are disguised as items.
Card.Description: Monsters are disguised as items, and will reveal themselves upon taking damage or if a player approaches them. Monsters can appear as any items currently in the map, except for keys. Despite their appearance, they retain their physique and can easily be revealed by firing near them. Only monsters that ambush players can be given an disguise.

Card.Name: Acquired Taste
Card.Hint: Monsters heal nearby monsters on death.
Card.Description: Whenever a monster dies, it will restore 90 health to nearby monsters. Monsters cannot over heal this way and cannot heal beyond their original health pool, but can quickly restore a monster back to full health if lots of monsters are killed near it.

Card.Name: Toxic Cadavers
Card.Hint: Some monsters leave behind toxic corpses.
Card.Description: Monsters may release a deadly gas upon death. Any players standing near the corpse will take damage. The gas will eventually stop after a few seconds, allowing players to safely pass. Radiation Suits and similar powers and items will protect players from the gas.

Card.Name: Icon's Blessing
Card.Hint: Several monsters receive a random card enchantment.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, several monsters receive a random card enchantment. 1 in 3 monsters will be affected, and the enchantment can be any from any enchantment card, even if no enchantment cards are in play.

Card.Name: Keys of Power
Card.Hint: Collecting keys gives monsters a random card enchantment.
Card.Description: Collecting keys in the level will give every single monster currently in the level a random card enchantment. The enchantment can be any from any enchantment card, even if no enchantment cards are in play. Monsters that are spawned after the key has been picked up will not gain the enchantment. A message will inform you which enchantment was selected when a key is picked up.

Card.Name: Vile Rebirth
Card.Hint: Resurrected monsters receive a random card enchantment.
Card.Description: Whenever a monster is resurrected or respawns (via a card or otherwise), it will gain a random card enchantment. The enchantment can be any from any enchantment card, even if no enchantment cards are in play. If a monster is resurrected multiple times, it can gain more and more enchantments.

Card.Name: Sealed Guardians
Card.Hint: Revealing a secret will spawn an enchanted monster.
Card.Description: Whenever a secret is revealed, a monster will be spawned nearby. The monster will have a random enchantment applied to it. The card will select a random monster type, but will favor stronger monster types. Upon spawning, the monster will immediately begin hunting players. The enchantment chosen can be any random enchantment, even if no enchantment cards are currently in play.

Card.Name: Pet Monsters
Card.Hint: Some monsters have a random monster pet.
Card.Description: Certain random monsters will spawn with a pet monster. The pet monster is attached to a chain and will be forced to accompany their master. The chain will break if either monster is killed. Pet monsters are of a random monster species, are smaller and have less health. If killed, their master will become enraged and become more aggressive. Certain monsters simply love pets, and may bring a collection of monsters with them.

Card.Name: Cherubs Descent
Card.Hint: Add several flying minature monsters to the level.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, several winged minature monsters are spawned. These minature monsters have half health and deal slightly less damage than their regular sized variants. They can also explore the map freely with their angel wings.

Card.Name: Blood Shift
Card.Hint: At the start of the level, two monster types swap health.
Card.Description: At the start of each level, two different monster types will be selected to have their health totals swapped. Boss monsters cannot be selected by this card. If chosen as a permanent card, two different monster types are selected at the start of each level. A red aura will surround any monsters that have had their health changed through this card.

Card.Name: Quickening
Card.Hint: All monsters move slightly faster.
Card.Description: All monsters receive a slight movement speed increase. This card can stack, further increasing the speed of all monster types.

Card.Name: Smoke Spite
Card.Hint: Dead monsters may release smoke clouds.
Card.Description: Killing a monster may release a large cloud of smoke. The smoke cloud does not harm the player but may obstruct their vision. Monsters are completely unaffected. Smoke clouds disappear after a few seconds.

Card.Name: Deliverance
Card.Hint: Resurrected monsters are teleported to a new location.
Card.Description: Whenever a monster is resurrected or respawns (via a card or otherwise), it will be teleported to a random location in the level.

Card.Name: Enchantment Echo
Card.Hint: Monsters that recieve random enchantments recieve another.
Card.Description: If any monster in the level acquires a random enchantment from a card effect, it will gain an additional random enchantment. The additional enchantment is completely random. If a card selected a random echantment to give to several monsters, each monster's second enchantment will be a different random enchantment.

Card.Name: Blessed Children
Card.Hint: Miniature monsters lose their damage reduction and gain a random enchantment.
Card.Description: Cards that would spawn or make monsters minature will also give the monsters a random enchantment. In addition, the damage and health reduction usually applied by shrinking a monster is negated. This means minature monsters take and dish out as much damage as their regular sized counterparts.

Card.Name: Balance The Scales
Card.Hint: Each monster in the level will be either removed or duplicated.
Card.Description: At the start of the level each monster has a 50% chance to be removed. Monsters that do not get removed have a copy of the monster spawned near them instead. Boss monsters are unaffected by this card.

Card.Name: Crushed Spirits
Card.Hint: Crushed corpses become vengeful spirits.
Card.Description: Whenever a monster corpse is crushed by a door or ceiling, it is destroyed and a vengeful spirit will appear in its place. Ghost monsters retain all the abilities of the monster that died and immediately start chasing the player. Ghosts move slower and have half the health of the original monster, but can walk through walls and objects to reach their target. Ghosts will eventually fade out of existence. Running away from them can be a viable strategy to conserve ammo.

Card.Name: Boss Arsenal
Card.Hint: Each boss monster gains a unique grenade to throw.
Card.Description: Each boss in the level gains the ability to throw a unique grenade. The grenade chosen is randomly selected out of all other grenade throwing abiltiy cards, even those that are not currently in play. Generally bosses will throw objects more frequently than normal monsters.

Card.Name: All Ghosts Return
Card.Hint: Resurrected monsters can phase through walls.
Card.Description: When a monster is resurrected, it gains the ability to move through the world freely and instantly climb cliffs. The monster acts and can be killed as normal. The monster will also be slightly more translucent than usual.

Card.Name: Thorns Totem
Card.Hint: Spawn a totem that causes monsters to retaliate with thorns.
Card.Description: The Thorns Totem gives monsters within its radius the ability to counter attack with thorn projectiles. The thorns deal little damage but ignore armor. Attacks that hit multiple times can be especially deadly as a thorn will be thrown for each hit.

Card.Name: Aegis Totem
Card.Hint: Spawn a totem that raises monster defence.
Card.Description: The Aegis Totem protects any monsters in its radius by greatly reducing incoming damage. Damage from players, monsters and cards is all reduced.

Card.Name: Turbo Totem
Card.Hint: Spawn a totem that speeds up monsters.
Card.Description: The Turbo Totem increases the action speed of all monsters in its radius, causing them to move and attack much faster. This effect stacks with other speed increasing cards.

Card.Name: Fireblu Totem
Card.Hint: Spawn a totem that cycles increased monster durability / damage.
Card.Description: The Fireblu totem cycles from red to blue every two seconds, granting a different buff depending on the color. Monsters glowing blue will take much less damage, while red glowing monsters will output double damage.

Card.Name: Warp Totems
Card.Hint: Totems may teleport after being dropped.
Card.Description: When a monster carrying a totem dies, it may teleport to a new monster to be carried once again. The first time the totem is dropped, it always teleports to a new monster. The chance of teleporting decreases each time the totem is handled by a new monster.

Card.Name: Bath Totem
Card.Hint: Spawn a totem that floats monsters away in bubbles.
Card.Description: The Bath Totem places monsters into bubbles. Monsters will float away inside the bubbles, enabling them to fly around. The monster cannot control the trajectery of the bubble as it bounces around, but allows them to reach areas they normally couldn't. A bubble can be popped if the monster is hit by a single attack. The attack's damage is also nullified, dealing no damage to the monster.

Card.Name: Change Totem
Card.Hint: Spawn a totem that transforms dying monsters into new ones.
Card.Description: The Change Totem will prevent a monster from dying, and will instead transform it into a new random monster at full health. \The new monster cannot be transformed again by any Change Totems, and will lack the green tint usually provided by the totem.

Card.Name: Duplication Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. Killing it duplicates nearby monsters.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, all nearby monsters spawn up to 3 extra copies of themselves. No more than 30 monsters can be spawned this way.

Card.Name: Miniature Army Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is secretly cursed. It explodes into a miniature army.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, it will split into several miniature versions of itself. These miniature monsters have half health and deal slightly less damage than their regular counterpart. Stronger monsters will split into less miniatures, but can still easily overwhelm unprepared players. This curse has no visual indicator, so you'll never know which monster is going to burst into a miniature army!

Card.Name: Rocketeer Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed, it rockets around uncontrollably.
Card.Description: The Rocketeer Curse causes the chosen monster to fly around erratically at high speeds, making it incredibly difficult to take down in large open areas. If resurrected by another monster, it will begin rocketing around once again.

Card.Name: Shifting Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed, it continuously swaps positions with others.
Card.Description: The chosen monster will instantly swap positions with another monster on the map every half of a second. The monster will continue to swap until there are no monsters left, or if it is slain. Monsters can still swap and be swapped mid-combat, making it difficult to pin down the cursed monster. If resurrected by another monster, it will begin swapping positions once again.

Card.Name: Nuclear Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed, it will cause a nuclear explosion when killed.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, it will begin flashing and growing in size. After 6 seconds, the monster will cause an earth shattering explosion, dealing massive damage to anything caught in its blast radius. Players can use cover to avoid the explosion, but anything too close to the explosion's center will be vaporized, even if they're behind a wall.

Card.Name: Prismatic Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. Killing it grants nearby monsters random enchantments.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, all nearby monsters are given two random card enchantments. The enchantments can be any from any enchantment card, even if no enchantment cards are in play.

Card.Name: Curse of the Cat
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. It must be killed 9 times.
Card.Description: The chosen monster is granted nine lives. When it dies, a new copy of the monster will spawn somewhere near the player after a few seconds. The cursed monster does not have a visual indicator of the curse, but will make a sound when it respawns. The monster will also gain any other benefits from cards that trigger via respawning. The cursed monster will continue to respawn until it has lost all nine lives.

Card.Name: Overpowered Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. It receives ten random card enchantments.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, the cursed monster will receive 10 random enchantments from different enchantment cards. Even if the enchantment cards are not in play, they can be selected as part of this curse. There is no indication of what enchantments the monster has received, so it may be worth studying what enchantments are possible using the compendium.

Card.Name: Polymorph Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. When it dies, nearby monsters become other monsters.
Card.Description: When the cursed monster dies, any nearby monsters are transformed into other monsters. Monsters can be transformed into any monster previously encountered, even if it does not exist in the current level. Weaker monsters are more likely to be transformed into stronger monsters. Certain special monsters and bosses cannot be transformed.

Card.Name: Curse of the Rabbit
Card.Hint: One monster is secretly cursed. It explodes into 100 eggs that contain ???.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, it will begin throwing eggs in random directions. 100 eggs in total will be thrown by this curse. The eggs may contain an item, a monster, an explosive surprise or nothing at all. Eggs created by this curse bounce around violently before exploding and revealing their contents.

Card.Name: Flea Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. It is flea-sized.
Card.Description: At the start of the level the cursed monster massively shrinks in size, making it much more difficult to see and hit. The cursed monster does not have its health reduced, but will easily be knocked around and into the air by attacks.

Card.Name: Abomination Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is secretly cursed. It can transform 10 times.
Card.Description: The cursed monster will transform into another full health random monster after losing a small portion of its base health. After transforming ten times, the curse is lifted and the final monster can be slain as normal.

Card.Name: Curse of Attention
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. Players cannot look away from it.
Card.Description: If a player is in range of the cursed monster, they will be forced to look towards it. If a player moves behind cover, their abilty to look freely is resorted. The cursed monster can be identified by the loud music it plays and the falling confetti, which will stop once the monster is slain.

Card.Name: Tachyon Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. It moves at top speed but deals less damage.
Card.Description: The chosen monster will move, attack and animate at an extreme speed. The monster also deals half the damage it normally would. Monsters with dangerous attack patterns or special abilities are much more deadly with this curse.

Card.Name: Monster Gang
Card.Hint: A gang of # may appear.
Card.Description: At some point during the level, a number of these monsters will begin spawning at one location. The location is random, but it will never be too close to any players. The amount of monsters depends on the strength of the monster. Weaker monsters will spawn in larger numbers. You will be alerted when the gang starts to arrive.

Card.Name: The Assassin
Card.Hint: A # will try to assassinate you.
Card.Description: At some point during the level, an Assassin monster of this type will spawn near a player just barely out of sight. Assassins will try not to make any noise and will immediately start to close in on the player's position. They will never infight and are much more aggressive, attacking immediately and continuously. They also have slightly increased health and deal much more damage. If killed, the Assassin will not spawn again. However, if chosen as a permanent card, the Assassin gains a health boost each level from when the card was first chosen.

Card.Name: Clone Monster
Card.Hint: All # in the level are increased by one.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, this monster will spawn with a copy of itself. This card cannot spawn more than 100 copies of the monster specified, though multiple copies of the same card can.

Card.Name: Small Companions
Card.Hint: # spawn with a mini companion.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, a smaller version of this monster will spawn next to the original. These miniature monsters have half health and deal slightly less damage than their regular counterpart. The small companion will usually appear near the original monster, but due to their size they may wander into areas the originals wouldn't. This card cannot spawn more than 100 small companions of the monster specified, though multiple copies of the same card can.

Card.Name: Vendetta
Card.Hint: # are always focused on players.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type have a vendetta, and will always focus their attention on players. Monsters with a vendetta will immediately start chasing any players that are alive, and will never target other monsters.

Card.Name: Carrier Upgrade
Card.Hint: # can carry other monsters.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will carry other monsters. When a monster encounters another monster of a different type, it will be placed on top of it. If the carried monster is blocked by a ceiling or another object, it will fall off. Monsters cannot carry monsters of the same type. If multiple monsters have this card, is is possible for carried monsters to carry other monsters, which is quite a sight to behold. Monsters that are being carried will attack more frequently.

Card.Name: Respawning Nightmare
Card.Hint: # respawn once after death.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will respawn once after death. This card only affects monsters that were originally placed in the level. After long duration, a monster that has died will respawn in the level. This duration is longer for stronger monsters. Even monsters that do not leave a corpse will be respawned by this card. Once the monster dies a second time, it cannot be respawned a second time. Although not the same as Doom's Nightmare! difficulty respawn mechanic, this card will not be offered if the game mode already respawns monsters.

Card.Name: Last Word
Card.Hint: # fires a @ projectile on death.
Card.Description: When this type of monster dies, a portal spawns and fires a projectile of the type specified. The portal takes a short duration before firing the projectile, and the projectile will be aimed at the one who killed the monster. This card's tier is dependent on the power of the projectile.

Card.Name: Necrokinesis
Card.Hint: # will pick up and throw dead monsters.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will pick up any nearby corpses, and attempt to throw them at the player shortly after. Thrown corpses deal moderate damage and pass through obstacles and other monsters.

Card.Name: Treachery
Card.Hint: # will prey on weaker monsters to gain offensive bonuses.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type receive various bonuses after killing another monster, whether it is on purpose or by accident. The monster's attacks will permanently deal double damage, and can be identified by red sparks. One 1/4th of their base health will also be healed, and will gain any enchantments from the killed monster. Monsters affected by this card will also turn on any monsters nearby with lower health, in an attempt to snag the benefits from their weak ally. The damage boost does not stack if they kill multiple monsters, and does not stack with the Blood Fury enchantment.

Card.Name: Promotion
Card.Hint: # gain the effects of your other Enchantment cards.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will gain all other enchantments from any other permanent enchantment cards in play. This card will always be offered to the weakest monster in the current level, and will only be offered if at least 3 enchantment cards are in play.

Card.Name: Feign Death
Card.Hint: # may pretend to die.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to feign death. Monsters with this ability will have less health than normal, but after being "killed" will resurrect themselves and begin hunting players once again. Monsters can only perform this ability once, but gain any benefits from being resurrected.

Card.Name: Distress Enchantment
Card.Hint: # may summon nearby allies when dying.
Card.Description: The specified monster has a chance to teleport in a nearby monster when it dies. The dying monster will try to summon a stronger monster if possible. The summoned monster immediately targets the player that killed the monster that called out to it.

Card.Name: Pre-emptive Strike
Card.Hint: # fire a @ projectile upon seeing a player.
Card.Description: When this monster is first able to see the player, a portal will quickly fire the specified projectile at the player. Each monster can only fire the projectile once, even if it is resurrected. The monster will not fire the projectile if it is busy targetting another monster, and will hold onto it until the player becomes its target. This card's tier is dependent on the power of the projectile.

Card.Name: Summoned Monsters
Card.Hint: Add extra # to the level.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, extra monsters of this type will be added at random locations in the level. The amount of monsters spawned is dependent on how strong the monster is, and how many monsters already exist in the level. This card cannot spawn more than 20 copies of the monster specified, though multiple copies of the same card can.

Card.Name: Recycle Essence
Card.Hint: # may consume a corpse to gain a random enchantment.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will devour any nearby dead monsters to gain a random card enchantment. The enchantment can be of any enchantment cards, even if they are currently not in play. Devoured corpses are completely removed from the game.

Card.Name: Hell Grenades
Card.Hint: # gain the ability to throw grenades.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to throw a bouncing grenade at their target. The grenades bounce off of floors, walls and ceilings and explode after a short duration. Stronger monsters throw grenades that deal more damage, and bosses throw grenades much more frequently.

Card.Name: Arachnid Mutation
Card.Hint: # may throw slowing web balls.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to throw sticky web balls. When a web ball explodes, the floor becomes webbed for a few seconds. Players have their speed drastically reduced while walking through the webs. Bosses throw web balls much more frequently.

Card.Name: Smoke Bombs
Card.Hint: # gain the ability to throw smoke bombs.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to throw a bouncing smoke bomb at their target. If the monster is badly wounded, it will drop the bomb at their feet. The bombs bounce off of floors, walls and ceilings and explode into clouds of smoke after a short duration. The smoke from the bombs doesn't harm the players and will disappear after a few seconds. Bosses throw smoke bombs much more frequently.

Card.Name: Void Walk
Card.Hint: # can create portals that teleport monsters and projectiles.
Card.Description: The chosen monster gain the ability to create portals that allow for teleportation. A portal will appear near the player and the monster, and both are linked. The monster who created the portal will immediately jump through and hunt the player. Other monsters and projectiles can also use the portals while they remain open, but players cannot.

Card.Name: Spawn Pods
Card.Hint: Add spawn pods that continuously spawn # until killed.
Card.Description: Adds several monster spawning pods to the level. These spawn pods spawn whichever monster has been selected by the card. Spawn pods will continuously spawn monsters, and must be killed to stop them. Each spawn pod is limited to 5 spawned monsters on the map, and will only spawn new ones if any of those 5 have died. Spawn pods can be resurrected by certain effects.

Card.Name: Concussion Grenade
Card.Hint: # gain the ability to throw bombs that knock entities away.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to throw a bouncing concussion grenade at their target. If the monster is badly wounded, it will drop the bomb at their feet. The bombs bounce off of floors, walls and ceilings. When they explode, all nearby entities are blasted away. This includes items, monsters, players and other shootable objects. Bosses throw concussion grenades much more frequently.

Card.Name: Unholy Water
Card.Hint: # gain the ability to throw vials that can resurrect monsters.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to toss vials of unholy water at their target. If the monster is badly wounded, it will drop the vial at their feet. When the vials hit a surface they break, releasing unholy water in a small radius. Unholy water does nothing to players, but resurrects dead monsters that get drenched in it.

Card.Name: Pumpkin Bombs
Card.Hint: # gain the ability to throw spooky bombs.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to throw Pumpkin Bombs. If the monster is badly wounded, it will drop the bomb at their feet. Pumpkin Bombs fly through the air erratically and bounce off of walls. Upon detonating, they explode in a large radius dealing damage. Any entities caught in the blast will become slightly invisible and have their colours changed. Players hit by the bombs will temporarily frighten other monsters, causing them to turn away for 3 seconds. Bosses throw Pumpkin Bombs more frequently.

Card.Name: Vile Executioner
Card.Hint: # can cast a fire spell on wounded players.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to cast a spell to engluf players in flames if they are at 25 or less health. The spell is almost identical to Doom's Archvile attack, and can be negated by avoiding the monster's line of sight.

Card.Name: Vile Vengeance
Card.Hint: # casts a fire spell while dying.
Card.Description: When this type of monster dies, it will cast a spell that englufs players in flames. The spell is almost identical to Doom's Archvile attack, and can be negated by avoiding line of sight of the deceased monster.

Card.Name: Mystery Egg Pouch
Card.Hint: # gain the ability to throw eggs that contain ???.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to toss Mystery Eggs at their target. The eggs may contain an item, a monster, an explosive surprise or nothing at all. Thrown eggs bounce around and deal damage to anything they hit before revealing their contents.

Card.Name: Enlightenment Powder
Card.Hint: # gain the ability to throw vials that give monsters brief immortality.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to toss vials of Enlightenment Powder. If the monster is badly wounded, it will drop the vial at their feet. If the vial breaks near a living monster, they will begin to glow for 4 seconds. During this time the monster cannot be killed, but can still be damaged and have its health dropped to 1 point.

Card.Name: Big Stomach
Card.Hint: # may swallow other monsters to conceal them.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to pull different monsters into their stomach with a stretchy tongue. Monsters that have been eaten are removed from play, until the fed monster is slain. When this happens, all the previously eaten monsters will be spawned back into the level. Returning monsters have their health and stats reverted, as if they were brand new monsters. Monsters with this ability can eat up to 5 monsters, and cannot eat boss monsters.

Card.Name: Hate Shield
Card.Hint: # cannot be damaged by other entities while infighting.
Card.Description: While monsters of this type are targetting another monster, they cannot be damaged by other sources. This includes other monsters, players, card effects or the environment. Monsters affected by this card will also be allowed to infight, even if they usually could not.

Card.Name: Alarming Mutation
Card.Hint: # may transform into @ when damaged.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, several monsters of this type are secretly chosen to have an alarming mutation. These monsters will instantly transform into a different monster once they have lost over half their health. Even if they are instantly killed, they will still transform. Any enchantments or abilities the old monster had are removed, as the new monster completely replaces it.

Card.Name: Tough Love
Card.Hint: # may shove other players and monsters away.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will occasionally shove any monsters or players. The victim will be pushed towards the monster's target, but will not recieve damage.

Card.Name: Backwards Compatible
Card.Hint: # always attacks and moves backwards.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type instead move and attack backwards. This card has no effect on the monster's behavior. The monster will still move and attack as normal, but will appear to be facing the opposite direction.

Card.Name: Revenge Strike
Card.Hint: # retaliate once with a @ projectile.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will retaliate with the selected projectile. The first time a monster is damaged by a player, it will fire the projectile at the player at high speed. This effect can only trigger once per monster affected by this card.

Card.Name: Fluffy Gifts
Card.Hint: # may sneak a useless item into your inventory.
Card.Description: Certain monsters of this type will secretly be carrying a Cacodemon Plush toy. When the monster gets close to a player, it adds the toy to the a random weapon slot in the player's inventory. The plush toy can be selected like ordinary weapons, but does nothing. It solely clogs up your weapon slot. To remove it, simply press the fire button to throw it away.

Card.Name: Banana
Card.Hint: # may eat a banana to regain health.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to eat a banana. After a monster has taken heavy damage, it may pull out a banana. After a short time, the banana is eaten. The monster regains a large portion of its health, then throws the banana peel on the ground. Players who step on the peel slip in the direction they were moving. If the monster is killed before the banana is eaten, the banana is destroyed. Monsters will occasionally also slip on banana peels.

Card.Name: Surge Bombs
Card.Hint: # gain the ability to throw bombs that speed up nearby entities.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to throw an electric bomb at their target. The bomb does no damage but instead charges up nearby monsters and players. Monsters caught in the radius will move and attack faster for three seconds, while players have their fire rate increased for one second. Bosses will throw bombs much more frequently.

Card.Name: Modeling Clay
Card.Hint: # gains the ability to throw a clay ball that becomes a statue.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type may throw a ball of clay at their target. The clay transforms into a statue of the monster that threw it. Monster can only perform this action once. Monster statues are solid objects that can be pushed around and block entities and projectiles. They are sturdy, but can be destroyed with enough damage or if they drop from a tall height. Enchantment cards affecting monsters may also be applied to monster statues.

Card.Name: Transmogrifier
Card.Hint: # gains the ability to polymorph other monsters.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to polymorph other monsters into different monsters. The monster will pull out a wand and cast the spell, which slowly travels to its destination monster. If the target monster is still alive, it will be transformed into a new monster. Bosses cannot be transformed. Transformed monsters also have their health set to full and status reset. The transform spell can only be cast once per monster, unless the caster is a boss monster.

Card.Name: Void Escape
Card.Hint: # may escape to the next level if in danger.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type have a chance to teleport to the next level once they are below half health. Monsters will appear at a random location in the next level and will immediately start chasing players. After entering a new level, they cannot escape a second time. Escaping monsters lose any additional properties, curses or enchantments they obtained on the current level.

Card.Name: Safety Bubble
Card.Hint: # may create bubbles while in danger. They allow monsters to float.
Card.Description: When this monster has been damaged, it may spawn a bubble for it and two other nearby allies. Monsters will float away inside the bubbles, enabling them to fly around. The monster cannot control the trajectery of the bubble as it bounces around, but allows them to reach areas they normally couldn't. A bubble can be popped if the monster is hit by a single attack. The attack's damage is also nullified, dealing no damage to the monster. Boss monsters with this effect can give out up to 10 bubbles instead.

Card.Name: Symbiosis
Card.Hint: # may spawn a miniature @ after dying.
Card.Description: Occasionally when a monster of this type dies, after a few seconds a miniature version of the second monster type is spawned. The miniature monster has half health and deals slightly less damage than normal, but inherit any enchantment effects the monster it spawned from had. If something is blocking the spawning monster, including players, the spawn will fail and no monster will be spawned.

Card.Name: Reactive Genes
Card.Hint: All # will gain a specific enchantment to counter players.
Card.Description: When monsters of this type in the level are reduced to half, the rest gain a specific enchantment. The enchantment chosen changes depending on how the majority of the monsters slain were killed. Players will be alerted when this happens. The possible enchantments are mostly defensive, and the enchantment is chosen based on various factors including distance from the player and types of damage taken.

Card.Name: Death Echo
Card.Hint: # spawn two copies on death. The copies immediately take fatal damage.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, two monsters of the same type are spawned where the monster dies. After a very short time the new monsters take damage equal to their health, killing the monster. The damage dealt to the new monsters can be prevented by other card effects. This card can only trigger 50 times per map.

Card.Name: Shield Enchantment
Card.Hint: # have a regenerating shield.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will have a regenerating shield. The shield blocks a single instance of damage completely, then is temporarily destroyed. If a monster takes no damage for five seconds, the shield will regenerate. Since the shield can absorb an infinite amount of damage, it is best to use rapid fire weapons to pop the shield instead of using strong slow weapons. The shields ignore monster damage completely, meaning monsters can damage monsters through them. However, the shield cannot be popped by monster damage either.

Card.Name: Aggression Enchantment
Card.Hint: # attack more aggressively.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will be more aggressive. Aggressive monsters will continuously attack their target if they're in their line of sight, making them much more dangerous. This card has the same effect as Fast Monsters (without the extra speed), thus will not be offered if playing on Nightmare difficulty or with Fast Monsters enabled.

Card.Name: Invisibility Enchantment
Card.Hint: # are partially invisible.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will be partially invisible. Partially Invisible monsters share the same invisibility as Spectres, making them very difficult to see in dark areas.

Card.Name: Unflinching Enchantment
Card.Hint: # no longer flinch.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will no longer flinch. A monster with this enchantment will never flinch in pain, making it impossible to interrupt their movement and attacks.

Card.Name: Silence Enchantment
Card.Hint: # hunt the player in silence.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will no longer make certain sounds. Monsters will not make a noise upon seeing the player, hunting the player or attacking. If a monster teleports, their teleport sound will also be muted. Indirect sounds, such as projectiles being thrown, can still be heard.

Card.Name: Flight Enchantment
Card.Hint: # are able to fly.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type can fly. Flying monsters can adjust their vertical position at will, and will often be able to reach players from places they usually wouldn't be able to.

Card.Name: Evasion Enchantment
Card.Hint: # will try to dodge your attacks.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will dodge to the left or right. If a monster's target is looking at them directly, they may execute a dodge maneuver. They will also try to dodge after taking damage. Monsters do not negate damage this way, and cannot dodge more than every second. Dodging monsters can move through objects, including other monsters and the player.

Card.Name: Swiftness Enchantment
Card.Hint: # have increased movement speed.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will move faster. Monsters affected by this enchantment will walk or fly almost twice as fast. This enchantment stacks with monsters that move faster when Fast Monsters is applied to them.

Card.Name: Gravity Enchantment
Card.Hint: # can invert its gravity.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type can invert their gravity at will, allowing them to walk on ceilings. Monsters will flip their gravity randomly while this enchantment is active, making them very unpredictable. This enchantment also allows monsters to walk off of edges, even when their gravity is normal.

Card.Name: Blood Fury Enchantment
Card.Hint: # deal extra damage if wounded.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will deal more damage while wounded. The damage dealt is increased slightly with each missing quarter of the monster's base health, up to a maximum of double damage. The more damage the monster is capable of, the more red sparks appear around the monster.

Card.Name: Haunting Enchantment
Card.Hint: # haunt players briefly after death.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will sometimes become a ghost after dying. Ghost monsters retain all the abilities of the monster that died and immediately start chasing the player. Ghosts move slower and have half the health of the original monster, but can walk through walls and objects to reach their target. Ghosts will eventually fade out of existence. Running away from them can be a viable strategy to conserve ammo.

Card.Name: Cannibalism Enchantment
Card.Hint: # consume corpses to gain extra health.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will devour any nearby dead monsters and gain extra health. The amount of health a monster gains is 75% of the consumed monster's original health, making it possible for monsters with small amounts of health to become much stronger. After consuming a corpse, the monster must wait a brief time before consuming another and cannot consume more than 4 corpses in total. Devoured corpses are completely removed from the game.

Card.Name: Petrification Enchantment
Card.Hint: # turn to stone on death.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will turn to stone on death. When a monster turns to stone, it doesn't leave a corpse or drop any items it usually would. Cards that trigger when a monster dies will still affect this monster. Stone monsters will block other objects and projectiles, and will be destroyed after taking enough damage. They can be pushed around by bumping into them, and break if they fall too far. Enchantment cards affecting the monster may also be applied to the monster statue.

Card.Name: Eject Enchantment
Card.Hint: # may teleport away if in danger.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type have a chance to teleport to a new random location in the level once they are below half health. After teleporting, the monster will immediately chase a random player if it was not already. If the monster is damaged again after it has already teleported, it will be able to teleport again. Monsters can only teleport once every 40 seconds.

Card.Name: Borrowed Time Enchantment
Card.Hint: # receive damage one second later.
Card.Description: Any damage dealt to this type of monster will be delayed. When something would usually deal damage to the monster, a second will pass before the monster actually receive the damage. This grants them a brief period of "invulnerability". Most damage will be delayed, however some special weapons and damage sources such as telefragging may ignore this enchantment.

Card.Name: Feather Enchantment
Card.Hint: # fly back further when damaged.
Card.Description: Monsters with this enchantment are weightless, and are sent flying when even the smallest of damage is dealt to them. Monsters may also temporarily pass through other entities when pushed into other monsters, players or objects.

Card.Name: Pursuit Enchantment
Card.Hint: # may teleport to pursue players.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will gain the ability to reposition themselves near players. Monsters will only teleport if their target is out of range and only if they have seen the player at least once. This enchantment can only trigger every few seconds per player.

Card.Name: Shockwave Enchantment
Card.Hint: # shoves nearby entities away on death.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will create a large shock wave when it dies. Shockwaves push nearby monsters, items, players and other shootable objects away from the dying monster. Shock waves cover a large radius, and even travel through walls.

Card.Name: Slide Enchantment
Card.Hint: # slide around while moving.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will slide around while moving. The monster will move around uncontrollably as if it were skidding on ice. This will allow the monster to fall off of ledges and dodge unpredictably.

Card.Name: Adrenaline Enchantment
Card.Hint: # moves and attacks faster at low health.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will move, act and attack much faster at lower health. A sound will play once the monster has activated their adrenaline. When the monster is critically wounded, the adrenaline gets even more potent, allowing the monster to move and attack even faster.

Card.Name: Slimming Enchantment
Card.Hint: # become thinner.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will become slim. Slimmed monsters have their hitbox radius reduced, making them harder to hit. This may also allow them to move to places they usually wouldn't be able to.

Card.Name: Illusionist Enchantment
Card.Hint: # may throw out 3 harmless illusions.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type have a chance to burst into 3 illusions upon reaching half health. The monster and its illusions will be thrust in different directions, making it not immediately apparent which one is the real monster. Illusions appear and act identical to regular monsters (and are even effected by other cards), but deal no damage to players. They are removed upon taking any player damage, do not trigger any death effects or leave a corpse. Though they cannot deal direct damage to players, they can still cause trouble in other ways... especially if they summon or resurrect enemies!

Card.Name: Firecracker Enchantment
Card.Hint: # explode several times shortly after dying.
Card.Description: When a monster of this type is slain, a fuse will light and begin burning down. Once the fuse runs out, the monster's corpse will explode several times, dealing damage to both monsters and players. If a monster with this enchantment dies to an explosion caused by a another Firecracker Enchantment, their fuse will not be lit and instead immediately start exploding. The amount of explosions is determined by the monster's maximum health.

Card.Name: Rampart Enchantment
Card.Hint: # takes less damage at long range.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type take less damage at long range. If the damage dealer is far enough to trigger the enchantment, a shield effect will appear on the monster, showing that it had the damage reduced.

Card.Name: Nightphase Enchantment
Card.Hint: # are invisible but leave a shadowy trail.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type are rendered completely invisible, but leave a shadowy trail behind them. The trail will mimic the monster's actions with a second delay, making it harder to pinpoint the monster's exact location.

Card.Name: Last Breath Enchantment
Card.Hint: # have a chance to prevent lethal damage once.
Card.Description: When a monster of this type would take lethal damage, it has a 1 in 3 chance to ignore the damage completely. If the enchantment triggers, it can no longer trigger again unless the monster is resurrected after it dies.

Card.Name: Berserker Enchantment
Card.Hint: # deals double damage at close range.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type deal double damage at close range. Any attack type will deal twice as much damage. Sparks will appear above the monster when their current target is in range of the enchantment effect.

Card.Name: Frenzy Enchantment
Card.Hint: # will move and attack faster briefly after seeing its target.
Card.Description: When a monster first lays eyes upon its target, it will have its animation speed doubled for very short time. The monster will move and attack much faster during this time, and may be able to attack multiple times. If the monster changes its target via infighting, or is killed and resurrected, it can trigger this enchantment again.

Card.Name: Launch Augment
Card.Hint: # projectiles travel twice as fast.
Card.Description: Causes a monster's projectiles to travel twice as fast. Seeker projectiles are not affected by this card.

Card.Name: Piercing Augment
Card.Hint: # projectiles ignore armor.
Card.Description: Causes a monster's projectiles to pierce armor. Armor piercing projectiles ignore player's armor entirely, dealing full damage as if weren't there. The armor itself is not damaged by these projectiles.

Card.Name: Shrouded Augment
Card.Hint: # projectiles are partially invisible.
Card.Description: Causes a monster's projectiles to be partially invisible. Only the core projectile is invisible. Any additional effects spawned by this projectile will not be partially invisible.

Card.Name: Vacuum Augment
Card.Hint: #'s damage knockback is reversed.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type have their knockback physics reversed. If an entity is damaged by this monster, it will be pushed towards the monster instead of away from it. The inverted damage knockback is also increased slightly.

Card.Name: Rubber Augment
Card.Hint: # projectiles bounce off of walls.
Card.Description: Causes a monster's projectiles to bounce off of walls. Projectiles will bounce off a wall a single time, and will not bounce off of ceilings and floors. If a projectile already had bouncing properties, the amount of bounces is increased by one.

Card.Name: Triple Augment
Card.Hint: # fire a spread of 3 projectiles.
Card.Description: Causes a monster to fire two extra copies of its projectile at different angles. The projectiles are fired at 35 degrees to the left and right of the monster. Certain special attacks may not be affected by this card.

Card.Name: Seeker Augment
Card.Hint: # projectiles are seekers.
Card.Description: Gives a monster's projectiles the ability to home in on targets. Much like Revenant missiles, their homing ability is fairly limited and they can be guided into walls by a skillful player. If the projectile fired was already a seeker, the homing ability is amplified instead.

Card.Name: Weave Augment
Card.Hint: # projectiles weave back and forth.
Card.Description: Causes a monster's projectiles to weave back and forth while traveling. Projectiles fired by this monster will start to weave back and forth in large arcs, making them difficult to predict and dodge. Projectiles will not start weaving until there is enough space to do so, however.

Card.Name: Heavy Augment
Card.Hint: # projectiles have massive knockback.
Card.Description: Makes a monster's projectile have massive amounts of knockback. Players, monsters or anything shootable is affected by the knockback.

Card.Name: Repeat Augment
Card.Hint: # throws a chain of 3 projectiles.
Card.Description: Causes a monster to fire three projectiles in a quick succession. If a monster fires multiple projectiles at the exact same time, only one of those projectiles will be fired this way.

Card.Name: Bullet Augment
Card.Hint: # fire bullets instead.
Card.Description: Replaces a monster's projectile's with bullets. The power of these hitscan attacks scale with the monster's base health. The stronger the monster, the more bullets are fired. Certain special attacks may not be changed into bullets.

Card.Name: Railgun Augment
Card.Hint: # fire a Railgun instead.
Card.Description: Replaces a monster's projectiles with a Railgun attack. The power of the monster's Railgun scale with the monster's base health. The stronger the monster, the more damage the Railgun does. Certain special attacks may not be changed into Railgun attacks.

Card.Name: Explosives Augment
Card.Hint: # projectiles explode on impact.
Card.Description: Causes a monster's projectiles to explode on impact. All projectiles fired by this monster cause an explosion that deals damage to anything nearby. The monster itself and monsters of the same type are not damaged by these explosions. The damage and radius of the explosion is dependent on the projectile's base damage.

Card.Name: Wide Augment
Card.Hint: # fire 3 projectiles in a line.
Card.Description: Causes a monster to fire two extra copies of its projectile at the left and right sides of the original. The projectiles are fired at the same angle and speed, and are close enough to each other to make dodging in between impossible. Certain special attacks may not be affected by this card.

Card.Name: Third Strike Augment
Card.Hint: Every third # projectile is extremely fast.
Card.Description: On every third attack, this monster type will fire its projectile(s) at quadruple speed. An effect trail will appear behind the projectile to show its velocity has been increased.

Card.Name: Enchanting Augment
Card.Hint: # give a random enchantment to any monsters they damage.
Card.Description: When monsters of this type would deal damage to another monster by via an attack or card effect, they instead give the monster an enchantment. Each individual monster affected by this card can only give out one enchantment type. Any damage dealt is also negated, unless they are currently targetting the monster that was hit.

Card.Name: Trickshot Augment
Card.Hint: # may adjust their aim for moving targets.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will occasionally adjust their aim to try and hit moving targets better. Every few projectiles this monster fires will be aimed towards where their target is moving to try and intercept them. If the target is too close to the monster, it will be fired as normal.

Card.Name: Zandronum Augment
Card.Hint: # projectiles may freeze mid-air.
Card.Description: This monster's projectiles will randomly stop and stutter in mid air. The affected projectiles can still interact and damage objects while stuck in the air, and will resume travel after a short time.

Card.Name: Chaos Augment
Card.Hint: # fires random monster projectiles instead.
Card.Description: When a monster of this type would fire its projectile, it will be replaced with a different random projectile. A different projectile is chosen each time.

Card.Name: Phase Augment
Card.Hint: # projectiles may phase through walls and entities.
Card.Description: Causes a monsters projectiles to occasionally phase through walls and entities. When a projectile is thrown by the monster it has a chance to become a phasing projectile. A phasing projectile will not collide with anything until it is close to the monster's target. Phasing projectiles can be identified by their purple trail.

Card.Name: BFG Augment
Card.Hint: # fires a BFG9000 instead.
Card.Description: Replaces a monster's projectiles with a BFG9000 projectile. After a short charge time the BFG ball is fired, devastating anything foolish enough to stand in the way. The BFG behaves exactly the same as Doom's BFG, firing damaging tracers from the monster's origin once the BFG ball explodes.

Card.Name: Weapon Augment
Card.Hint: # fires @ projectiles instead.
Card.Description: Replaces a monster's projectile attack with another. Whenever a monster would fire a projectile, it will fire the new one specified by the card instead. Even if the monster originally fired 3 different projectiles, they will all be replaced with the new one. Certain special attacks may not be replaced.

Card.Name: Upgrade Augment
Card.Hint: Each # fire a different monster's projectiles.
Card.Description: Every monster of this type will attack with a stronger monster's projectiles. Whenever a monster would fire a projectile, it will fire a different monster's projectile. Even if the monster originally fired 3 different projectiles, they will all be replaced with the new one. If there are multiple monster types to choose from that have stronger attacks, each monster will be assigned a different one at the start of the level. Certain special attacks may not be replaced.

Card.Name: Global Swarming
Card.Hint: A shark infested tornado may tear through the level.
Card.Description: At a random point in time, a tornado will slowly begin tearing through the level. The tornado will slowly travel towards a player's location, picking up and hurling any entities caught inside its large radius. After a while the tornado will continue to pass through the level in a straight path until it disappears. Though the tornado appears randomly, players are notified when it starts. Depending on the level, it may even be possible to see it approaching. The tornado also has sharks inside of it.

Card.Name: The Dunkening
Card.Hint: All monsters can leap at their prey.
Card.Description: All monsters receive a more potent version of the Leap Enchantment, which allows them to trigger their leap ability more often. Monsters will occasionally try to leap at their current target if it is far away from them, allowing them to reach places they normally wouldn't be able to and catch players off guard. Monsters will only use this ability if they are on the floor and can currently see their target. If the monster can fly, it may dash towards the player while in the air.

Card.Name: The Duplicard
