Card.Hint: Add 4 more copies of # to the game.
Card.Description: When offered to the player, this card choses one of the active permanent cards to duplicate. If it is chosen, it creates four more copies of the card and adds them to the active collection of cards permanently. Only cards with effects that are able to be stacked can be selected for this card's effect.

Card.Name: Season's Greetings
Card.Hint: You will encounter Santa and his unusual reindeer.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, Santa will appear somewhere. He rides in on his bright red sleigh, which is pulled by 8 monsters of the same type. The type of monster is a monster that exists in the current level. While flying through the air, the monsters can attack players. Once all of them are dead, the sleigh explodes and Santa falls to the ground where he will try to defend himself with a shotgun.

Card.Name: Dr. Imp's Revenge
Card.Hint: All monsters have a chance of transforming into another.
Card.Description: Every monster in the level will have a chance to transform into another monster type after taking damage. Monsters will instantly transform into a different monster once they have lost over half their health. Even if they are instantly killed, they will still transform. Any enchantments or abilities the old monster had are removed, as the new monster completely replaces it. Monsters that have transformed via this card cannot transform again.

Card.Name: Hand of Baphomet
Card.Hint: Replace the Icon of Sin with a new boss.
Card.Description: Replaces the Icon of Sin (or Spider Mastermind) with a new boss, ROM3R-0.666. ROM3R-0 will chase players and attempt to gun them down with his 4 minigun cannons. If his target is out of range, he will leap towards them and slam into the ground causing damage in a large area. If he still cannot locate the target, he will teleport near them and resume the hunt. Once ROM3R-0 is almost defeated, he will start summoning random monsters nearby and gain a regenerating shield.

Card.Name: Leaking Soul
Card.Hint: Your bonus health drains over time.
Card.Description: Players slowly lose any bonus health they've gained. If a player has any extra health beyond their starting health, they will lose a point of it every second.

Card.Name: Annoying Devil
Card.Hint: A devil will follow players and cause mischief.
Card.Description: At the start of the level a purple devil will begin following players. The devil will always stay close to the player until it decides to interact with something. The devil can push enemies around, teleport items away, detonate explosive objects and other mischevious things. The devil cannot be interacted with or killed, and will stay with the player until the end of the level. The more enemies that are killed in the level, the more active the devil will be.

Card.Name: Unfinished Business
Card.Hint: Monsters you left alive in previous levels will return.
Card.Description: Any monsters left alive in any previous levels will spawn in the current level. After 10 seconds the monsters will begin spawning in at random locations. This card will only appear if at least 10 monsters have been left alive over the course of the entire game. A maximum of 100 monsters can follow you from the previous level, and can include boss monsters.

Card.Name: Marked for death
Card.Hint: Monsters begin hunting players from the start.
Card.Description: All monsters will wake up at the start of the level and begin hunting players. Monsters can still infight and change targets, but will not forget about the player until they have been slain.

Card.Name: Sludge Rain
Card.Hint: Sludge rain will fall outside, slowing your movement.
Card.Description: Every few minutes, sludge rain will fall from the sky, slowing the movement of any players under it. Rain can only fall in areas where the sky is exposed. If other rain cards are also in effect, the different rain types will fall in sequence instead of at the same time.

Card.Name: Poultry Hazard
Card.Hint: Chickens will appear. Avoid killing them at all costs.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, lots of harmless chickens will spawn at random locations. The chickens are harmless and are not counted as monsters, and are unaffected by cards. They can only be harmed by players. They ignore any other source of damage. Killing 12 or more chickens will cause them to attack players relentlessly. They will teleport in endlessly, making hiding impossible. Should the player survive for 30 seconds, they will cease their attack.

Card.Name: Shadows Manifest
Card.Hint: A damaging shadow will spawn and trail behind players.
Card.Description: After a certain number of monsters are slain, a shadow player figure will spawn. After a few seconds the shadow will begin mimicing the player's movements. If a player gets too close to a shadow, they will take damage. The shadow cannot be killed and is only dispelled once the level is over. If this card is chosen as a permanent card, extra shadow figures will appear every few levels.

Card.Name: Blade Traps
Card.Hint: Spawn several spinning blade traps in the level.
Card.Description: At the start of the level several spinning blade traps are spawned. These bladed columns move back and forth in a line, damaging both players and monsters who get too close to them. Nothing can destroy the traps, they must simply be avoided.

Card.Name: Teleport Shock
Card.Hint: When something teleports, a shockwave shoves entities away .
Card.Description: Whenever a teleporter is used or a card effect causes an entity to teleport, a shockwave is created at the destination. Shockwaves push nearby monsters, items, players and other shootable objects away from the entity. Shock waves cover a large radius, and even travel through walls.

Card.Name: Co-operative Evil
Card.Hint: Monsters no longer infight.
Card.Description: Monsters will no longer infight, outside of special conditions. If one monster damages another, they will take the damage and continue chasing the player if they are aware of them.

Card.Name: Breach!
Card.Hint: Monsters gain a speed boost when they open doors.
Card.Description: When a monster would open a door, it is instead opened at full speed and all nearby monsters gain a speed boost. The speed boost lasts 15 seconds but does not stack with other cards that increase monster speed.

Card.Name: Hotter Start
Card.Hint: At the start of the level, 20 monsters are teleported near players.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, 20 random monsters in the level are teleported from their original position in the level, to a random location near players. Monsters can be of any type, and immediately face the player upon being moved.

Card.Name: Adaptable Foe
Card.Hint: Bosses gain up to 3 random enchantments while in combat.
Card.Description: All bosses in the level will gain a random enchantment upon reaching certain health intervals. One enchantment will be given at 85%, one at 60% and one final enchantment at 35% health. Enchantments can be any from any enchantment card, even if no enchantment cards are in play.

Card.Name: The Howling
Card.Hint: Monsters may transform into a Werewolf when damaged.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, several monsters a marked as a werewolf. At low health, they will transform into wolf form. Any card enchantments are transferred to the wolf form. While transformed, werewolves hunt players at high speed and ignore other monsters. Werewolves have a fast melee attack that can kill players quickly. If their target is on a high ledge, they may leap into the air to try to reach the player. When killed, the werewolf transforms back into its previous form and dies.

Card.Name: Chain Resurrections
Card.Hint: When a monster resurrects, another nearby is also resurrected.
Card.Description: Whenever a monster would be resurrected by a monster or card effect, a nearby dead monster will also be resurrected. When this happens, a green chain effect will reveal the second resurrection.

Card.Name: Night Totem
Card.Hint: Spawn a totem that makes monsters invisible.
Card.Description: The Night Totem makes any monsters in its radius completely invisible. They will be made visible again if they die or leave the radius of the totem.

Card.Name: Vile Totem
Card.Hint: Spawn a totem that resurrects nearby monsters.
Card.Description: The Vile Totem resurrects a single monster in its radius every couple of seconds. If the totem carrier is killed and resurrected, the totem will not be picked up again.

Card.Name: Concealed Totems
Card.Hint: Totems are invisible until dropped.
Card.Description: All totems are completely invisible. Totems will also no longer show their radius of effect or play sounds. If the monster carrying the totem dies and the totem is dropped, it becomes visible again.

Card.Name: Lethality Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. Killing it drastically lowers your health.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, all players will have their current health reduced to a tenth. Players are also given a brief moment of invincibility when this happens. Smart players will leave extra health items lying around before killing this monster.

Card.Name: Resurrection Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. Killing it resurrects nearby monsters.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, it will resurrect nearby dead monsters in a large area around it. There is no limit on how many monsters can be resurrected this way, and it can even affect dead monsters behind walls.

Card.Name: Mirror Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. Killing it mirrors your world.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, it will cause the entire level to become mirrored to players. However, it is only an illusion. Dying or reaching the end of the level will break the curse. If a second monster has the Mirror Curse and dies, it will mirror the world back to normal.

Card.Name: Invisibility Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. It is completely invisible.
Card.Description: The Invisibility Curse makes the chosen monster completely invisible. The monster will still make sounds, bleed and make itself known with attacks. Even death does not free it from the curse. If resurrected by another monster, it will become invisible again.

Card.Name: Miasma Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. Killing it makes nearby floors toxic.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, a wide area around the monster will be flooded with a damaging purple miasma. The miasma behaves similar to damaging floors, and the damage can be mitigated by certain powerups.

Card.Name: Vegetation Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is secretly cursed. Killing it spawns vegetation.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, vegetation begins to grow around the dead monster and the player that killed it. These plants cannot be interacted with and simply block the player's sight, making it more difficult to see monsters and projectiles.

Card.Name: Curse Of Decay
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. When it dies, exploding critters infest nearby corpses.
Card.Description: When the cursed monster dies, all nearby corpses in a large radius are infested with exploding critters. Upon approaching an infested corpse, the critters will leap out and attack. Exploding critters scurry around searching for players. They attack by leaping at their prey and exploding. Critters can be killed and are classed as monsters, but do not effect the kill count. Stronger monsters have even more critters hididng inside them.

Card.Name: Incineration Curse
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. Killing it burns nearby items.
Card.Description: When the cursed monster dies, items in a large radius around the monster are immediately burned to a crisp, removing them from play.

Card.Name: Curse of Achilles
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. It can only be damaged at very close range.
Card.Description: A large shield will appear around the chosen monster, protecting it. Any damage it recieves will be negated, unless the source of the damage is in very short range of the monster. Players will have to get up close to deal damage to it. Other monsters will also do no damage to the cursed monster unless they are at close range. Crushers and other hazards that may damage the cursed monster will still deal damage to it.

Card.Name: Kleptomania
Card.Hint: # will steal items off the ground.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will steal items off the ground. Stolen items will be carried by the monster until they are slain. Often seen as a blessing when monsters "deliver" items to you, can be a curse if a monster steals an important item behind an impassible barrier. At the start of the level, monsters preemptively steal items much further away from them, claiming items from secrets and other areas they would not normally reach. Items such as keys cannot be stolen.

Card.Name: Casali's Watchers
Card.Hint: # may become an immobile, self-resurrecting sentry.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type have a chance to be a sentry. Four skulls will appear around the monster to signify they have become a sentry. Sentries will resurrect themselves almost immediately after dying, becoming an immortal threat. However, they cannot move from their position at all. Sentries do not block players or other monsters, and do not count towards the total kills after being resurrected. They will however trigger any other resurrection and death effects.

Card.Name: Forbidden Gaze
Card.Hint: Looking at # for too long burns the player.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type become forbbiden to look at by players. If a player stares at a forbidden monster for more than a second or so, they will ignite and begin to take damage. The damage dealt increases the longer the player stares at the monster. Simply looking away ends the effect and resets the damage. Looking at a different monster of the same type will continue to burn the player however.

Card.Name: Living Vessel
Card.Hint: # spawns 3 @ when killed.
Card.Description: When this monster dies, 3 of the specified monster will spawn where it died. The monsters spawned are thrown in 3 directions and if killed by the player, immediately face them. Should the spawned monster also happen to have a card with this effect, they cannot then spawn monsters this way after dying. This card can only trigger 50 times per map.

Card.Name: Noxious Vials
Card.Hint: # gain the ability to throw poison gas vials.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to toss vials of deadly poison at their target. If the monster is badly wounded, it will drop the vial at their feet. The vials expell a deadly gas upon hitting a surface, which lingers for a few seconds before disappearing. Players will take damage over time if they remain in the gas. Powerups that usually protect from nukage will not protect players from this type of gas. Bosses throw vials much more frequently.

Card.Name: Barbarity
Card.Hint: # always deal the highest damage they've ever dealt.
Card.Description: When this monster deals damage, it will always deal the highest amount its type has ever dealt (to a monster or player) in this level. If the monster has multiple attack types, it will still deal the highest damage possible. The highest damage recorded for each monster is reset after each level.

Card.Name: Reflect Enchantment
Card.Hint: # reflect projectiles back at you.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will reflect projectiles. Reflected projectiles will be thrown back at the target at half of the original projectile's speed and damage, making strong projectile weapons dangerous against these monsters. However, monsters will still take full damage from the projectile even if they are reflected. Projectiles from other monsters will also be reflected back, making them much better at infighting.

Card.Name: Acid Blood Enchantment
Card.Hint: # bleeds lethal acid.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will spew acid blood upon taking damage. The amount and speed of the acid is dependent on the amount of damage the monster receives in a single attack. Every instance of damage causes an acid spray, making shotguns very dangerous to use against these monsters. Monsters are completely immune to this acid.

Card.Name: Leap Enchantment
Card.Hint: # can leap at their prey.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type gain the ability to leap at their target. Monsters will occasionally try to leap at their current target if it is far away from them, allowing them to reach places they normally wouldn't be able to and catch players off guard. Monsters will only use this ability if they are on the floor and can currently see their target. If the monster can fly, it may dash towards the player while in the air.

Card.Name: High Voltage Enchantment
Card.Hint: # will electrocute nearby players.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type will shock nearby players with a stream of electricity. If a player gets too close to a monster with this enchantment, they will start losing health rapidly. Players must get out of range or kill the monster to avoid being shocked. The electricity damage does not stack with other nearby monsters with this enchantment. Larger monsters can shock players further away from their center.

Card.Name: Infestation Enchantment
Card.Hint: Exploding critters may hide inside # corpses.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type have a chance to be infested with exploding critters. Upon approaching an infested corpse, the critters will leap out and attack. Exploding critters scurry around searching for players. They attack by leaping at their prey and exploding. critters can be killed and are classed as monsters, but do not effect the kill count. Stronger monsters have even more critters hididng inside them.

Card.Name: Bombardment Augment
Card.Hint: # continuously throw projectiles.
Card.Description: Every monster of this type will continuously throw its projectile at the player. After the monster has seen the player once, it will keep throwing projectiles at a steady rate, even if it can no longer see its target. If a player is not the monster's current target, they will cease the bombardment. This augment stacks with other augments, allowing new attacks to be used as a bombardment.

Card.Name: Electric Augment
Card.Hint: # projectiles electrocute nearby players.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type throw projectiles that are electrified. If a player gets too close to an electrified projectile, they will start losing health rapidly. Players must get out of range of the projectile to avoid being shocked. The electricity damage does not stack with other electrified projectiles.

Card.Name: New Hunting Grounds
Card.Hint: Remove most monsters, but replace some with Archviles.
Card.Description: Most of the monsters in the level are removed, but some are replaced by Archviles. Roughly 1 in 8 monsters will be replaced with an Archvile, or whatever monster replaces them in the current mods. If chosen as a permanent card, the event has a small chance to trigger at the start of each level.

Card.Name: Curse of Dormin
Card.Hint: One monster is cursed. Killing it transforms you into the monster.
Card.Description: When the chosen monster dies, it sends out a dark wave of energy at the player. Then, after a few seconds, the player will transform into a copy of the monster that died. While in monster form, you cannot use your weapons and can only attack the same way as the monster. You can use Altfire to attack without using auto-aim. After killing a certain amount of monsters, or if you find the level exit, you will revert back into your normal form.

Card.Name: Oath to the Old God
Card.Hint: 5 monsters become disciples. If they all die, the Ancient One is summoned.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, five random monsters are chosen to become disciples of the Ancient One. They are identified by an eye that hovers above them, and can no longer be damaged by other monsters. Once all five have been killed, the Ancient One spawns in the level. The Ancient One chases players around the level, and will throw massive energy projectiles at them. It has more health than two Cyberdemons combined, so try to avoid fighting it. If you do manage to destroy the Ancient One, and this card is permanent, it will return with twice as much health as last time.

Card.Name: Demand / Supply
Card.Hint: Items are removed. Stand still and hold USE to spawn them all.
Card.Description: All items in the level are removed at the start of the level. In order to survive, you may call in one single supply drop. Holding the USE button while standing still will send out the signal to your position. All the items normally found in the level will be teleported near your position. Choose where to call down the supplies wisely, as this can only be used once per level!

Card.Name: Endless Flow
Card.Hint: A green liquid will slowly fill the level, resurrecting monsters.
Card.Description: At the start of the level, mucus will slowly begin pouring into the level from the player's starting location. Mucus has no effect on the players but will occasionally resurrect fallen monsters.

Card.Name: Angry Bones
Card.Hint: Remove all monsters in this level, but an angry Revenant stalks you.
Card.Description: All the monsters in the current level are removed, and a single stalking Revenant is spawned somewhere in the level. This Revenant is relentless, and is best avoided at all costs. It will follow you all around the level, finding you in places you might not expect. If you have the proper equipment, fighting it is an option... but it will return 40 seconds later. If chosen as a permanent card, the Revenant may return on a later level without any monsters being removed.

Card.Name: Grace of Lilith
Card.Hint: |index entry637:changes manynfDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD NON-ZDOOM DETECTED, PLEASE START IN REGULAR ZDOOM NON-ZDOOM DETECTED, PLEASE START IN REGULAR ZDOOM NON-ZDOOM DETECTED, PLEASE START IN REGULAR ZDOOM - whoami

Card.Name: Swimming Lessons
Card.Hint: One Key is trapped, and will spawn 3 bosses.
Card.Description: At the start of the level one key is trapped, and will summon 3 bosses when it is collected. The bosses are spawned relatively close to the player, and a short song will play once the trap has sprung.

Card.Name: Break the Bat
Card.Hint: Bane will challenge you to a 1 on 1 fight.
Card.Description: The Gotham supervillain Bane will appear in the level and begin taunting the player into a fight. Bane is immune to damage until a player approaches him and starts the fight. Bane will attack the player with his enhanced strength, and will not let players leave his vicinity until the battle is over. Cowardly players can avoid the fight altogether, though Bane has been known to take hostages.

Card.Name: Second Slice
Card.Hint: You must do a second lap of the level under a time limit.
Card.Description: Upon reaching the exit of the level, players will be teleported back to the beginning with no keys. Some monsters are also resurrected. Players must locate the exit a second time in order to end the level. A timer will be counting down during the second lap. If the timer reaches zero, all players explode violently. In multiplayer, the countdown is reset. While the timer ticks down, additional random monsters will be spawned into the level near players. Several monsters are also spawned near the exit.

Card.Name: Scent Of Blood
Card.Hint: After taking 100+ damage, extra monsters will spawn.
Card.Description: After a player takes 100 damage during a level, 15 extra monsters will spawn at random locations. You will be notified when this happens. The monster types are random monsters that can be found in the current level, except for boss monsters. The spawned monsters do not immediately start chasing players, and may end up ambushing them instead. The amount of damage a player must take to spawn even more monsters is increased by 150 each time. If the card is chosen as a permanent card, the health totals reset after each map. In cooperative mode, each player's health is tracked individually.

Card.Name: Boiling Blood
Card.Hint: Players bleed damaging pools of blood.
Card.Description: When players take damage, a pool of boiling blood appears near them. The pool of blood will rapidly damage any players who stand in it. Hazard resistance items such as Radiation Suits do not prevent damage. The pools of blood disappear after a short duration.

Card.Name: Wrath Sentries
Card.Hint: Add several sentries that fire # projectiles.
Card.Description: Add several sentries to the level that fire the specified projectile. These sentries spawn on random walls in the level and often appear near the ceiling. While a player is in their sight, the eye will open and begin firing projectiles at them. They will cease firing if a player is behind cover. Wrath sentries cannot be destroyed but can be briefly stunned if hit by a player or monster. The number of Wrath Sentries is dependent on the amount of monsters in the map, but is limited to 15 (for every copy of this card).

Card.Name: Cult Chow
Card.Hint: Health items become Priest Porridge (tastes better warm!)
Card.Description: At the start of the level, most of the lesser health items are replaced with Priest Porridge. Priest Porridge heals for 5 health when picked up while cold, or 30 if heated. To heat Priest Porridge, it must be hit with a Fire type attack or any kind of blast damage. Priest Porridge can also be heated by certain damaging floors.

Card.Name: Brutal Totem
Card.Hint: Spawn a totem that doubles monster damage.
Card.Description: The Brutal Totem doubles the damage output of any monsters in its radius.

Card.Name: Frankenstein's Gift
Card.Hint: # can stitch together two corpses to make a new monster.
Card.Description: Monsters of this type can combine two dead monsters into one new living creature. They can only perform this operation 3 times, and can only combine monsters of different types. Certain monsters such as bosses cannot be stitched together this way. The new creature inherits certain traits, physics and enchantments from the original monsters. It will also have the best speed and health from the two subjects. Once the combined creature dies it cannot be used by another Frankenstein ability.

Card.Name: Armageddon
Card.Hint: After 1000 kills, all monsters are given the Nuclear Curse.
Card.Description: After a player has slain one thousand monsters over the course of the game, all monsters in the level will be given the Nuclear Curse. No warning is given when this happens. When a cursed monster dies, it will begin flashing and growing in size. After 6 seconds, the monster explode, dealing massive damage to anything caught in its blast radius. Players can use cover to avoid the explosion, but anything too close to the explosion's center will be vaporized, even if they're behind a wall.

Card.Name: Mega Deathmatch
Card.Hint: An 8-bit warrior will challenge you.
Card.Description: At some point during the level, a robot warrior will spawn near a player and begin attacking. The warrior will chase the player around the level, ignoring other monsters, and attack with armor piercing plasma bolts. If the player is too far away, they may teleport close to their target. They can also utilize their copy weapon ability to fire projectiles used by other monsters, making their attacks unpredictable.

Notes:
The goal is to avoid the following:
  - Potentially map-breaking cards
  - Special "achievement" style or other cards that can by themselves make gameplay grindy or annoying.
  - Progress-inhibiting or reversing cards.

Some cards i've disabled may seem borderline or "not too bad" but keep in mind that due to eggs, random enchantments, and so on - any card in the deck could pop up at any time.  Possibly annoying card in a possibly annoying scenario is no bueno.

Difficulty scaling is disabled, and duplicates are enabled.  This ensures maximum variety in card selection.  IMO, variety is what makes Corruption Cards great.  As such i use pick 3 from 8 cards in custom mode, adjusting the permanent card frequency to the size of the WAD aiming for a maximum of 15 or so permanent cards.  Too many cards gets grindy, grindy is not fun.
Name: BigMacDeck
